entry.title: keep a record of some shoud be log
entry.content:
UPDATE:
やっぱり　uncomfortable from now then on …

After several hours,I can calm down to review my short but unforgettable love.

What did I do wrong is obvious , but what is the origen reason .

Think twice , the other one have not did anything wrong , so,I am the bad one,I have hurted
one’s heart.

I am guilty…

Anyway , I wish all can return to a normal status…

entry.title: use python edit xlsx
entry.content:
Yesterday , a girl ask me to solve a problem
that need to change cell’s content in more than
ten thousand regular xlsx files.To show power
to the opposite sex,I say Yes of course.

Then I easily find some python tools working with
xlsx and xlsx:xlrd,xlrt,openpyxl.so I choose openpyxl.

but I noticed that xlsx file’s style be changed by openpyxl
which is unacceptable.
So I ask for help at archlinuxcn bbs.Quckily ,a nice
one find the problem(I wonder it is encode problem at first)
is style , and give his advice that do it on windows and use
com connector.

Then , I esaily find pywin32 ,It can solve my problem!

then,I did it .
push my ugly code and a example file soon.

pywin32 throw a error:can’t find name.xlsx

later , I see the error.
finally,I find a way to solve it :
use os.path.abspath(filename) to get real path then
pass it to pywin32.

wish that is real end .
entry.summary:
Yesterday , a girl ask me to solve a problem
that need to change cell’s content in more than
ten thousand regular xlsx files.To sho

entry.title: count every kind of character in text
entry.content:
By accident,I want to do one thing ,count char in my C programming course,by using shell.
I have learn a little shell before , I know if there is a text , and it’s each line only
one single letter,then I can use sort and uniq to solve the problem.
But I don’t know how to convert,you know ,common text will not only have single char line.
So I ask other in openSUSE CN forum,and fortunately ,I got an answer .
Thanks to forum and xiaohuoban .

code is here

if you know regex, you see the char ‘.’ means one any char.

that’s all.
thank them again.

entry.title: 《深度探索Linux操作系统》构建过程中的问题
entry.id: https://doublehou.github.io/2016/11/29/《深度探索Linux操作系统》构建过程中的问题/
entry.content:
今日准备“按图索骥”，开始按书中所说，从头构建一个linux系统。

首先在openSUSE 20161123 上完成了准备工作。
开始编译了。
但是卡在了第一步：build binutils-2.23 。
报了一个错误： error:right-hand operand of comma expression has no effect …

wtf.

然后我就想哪里错了呢？

看到了“x86_64”。我想大概是这个原因。书上的是”i386-pc-linux-gnu”这样的。

那我看看笔记本中的archlinux显示啥吧…then，出现了“x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu”,看起来差不多嘛。

又做了一遍准备工作。然而，又报错了。。。

发了一会儿呆。。。

突然想到，大概是书中的光盘里的binutils太老了?毕竟当时作者还在用ubuntu12.10呢。

于是下载最新的，就是binutils-2.27了。

解压，编译，通过。

嗯。再看看 $MACHTYPE ,咦，怎么和openSUSE 的一样了，都是”x86_64”。
再仔细一看，原来如此。是shell不同造成的。
zsh 显示的是短的，bash显示的是长的。
那我看看openSUSE的bash里的是啥吧，结果是“x86_64-suse-linux”

那把 $HOST 改改看看能不能有所变化。

数分钟后。。果然还是不行。

最后 ，gcc -v -> 6.2.1 20160830
entry.summary:

开始编译了。
但是卡在了第一步：build binutils-2.23 。
报了一个错误： error:righ
